steps.name: Notice Period
steps.description: Landlord must serve proper written notice to tenant

steps.name: File Landlord-Tenant Complaint
steps.description: Landlord files complaint with Magisterial District Court

steps.name: Court Hearing
steps.description: Judge hears case; both parties present evidence

steps.name: Judgment
steps.description: Court rules for landlord or tenant

steps.name: Appeal Period
steps.description: Losing party has 30 days to appeal

steps.name: Order of Possession
steps.description: If no appeal or appeal fails, order issued
steps.timeline: After appeal period (11th day after judgment)

steps.name: Physical Eviction
steps.description: Constable or sheriff executes order and removes tenant

timeline.curePeriod: 10 days - tenant can pay all rent due to stop eviction

defenseOptions.name: Improper Notice
defenseOptions.description: Challenge the adequacy or service of the 10-day notice
checklist: Was notice in writing?
Did notice state amount of rent due?
Was notice properly served (personal, posted AND mailed)?
Was full 10-day period given before filing?
Does notice demand possession or payment?

defenseOptions.name: Payment Made Within Cure Period
defenseOptions.description: All rent was paid within the 10-day notice period
checklist: Was full amount of rent claimed paid?
Was payment made within 10-day period?
Did landlord accept payment?

defenseOptions.name: Breach of Warranty of Habitability
defenseOptions.description: Property has serious conditions affecting habitability
checklist: Are there serious conditions affecting health/safety?
Is property weatherproof and watertight?
Are plumbing, heating, electrical working?
Did you notify landlord of conditions in writing?
Did landlord fail to make repairs within reasonable time?
defenseOptions.caveat: May reduce rent owed; must follow proper rent withholding procedures

defenseOptions.name: Acceptance of Partial Payment
defenseOptions.description: Landlord accepted partial payment after serving notice, potentially waiving eviction right
checklist: Was partial payment accepted after notice served?
Did landlord provide receipt?
Was there agreement to accept partial payment?

defenseOptions.name: Improper Charges Included
defenseOptions.description: Amount claimed includes fees or charges not authorized by lease
checklist: Review lease for authorized fees
Are late fees properly calculated per lease?
Are there charges not in lease?
Is rent calculation correct?

defenseOptions.name: Retaliatory Eviction
defenseOptions.description: Eviction filed in response to tenant exercising legal rights
checklist: Did you recently complain about conditions?
Did you report code violations?
Did you organize with other tenants?
Was eviction filed shortly after protected activity?
defenseOptions.timingGuidance: Presumption of retaliation if eviction within reasonable time after protected activity

defenseOptions.name: Security Deposit Violation
defenseOptions.description: Landlord failed to properly handle security deposit
checklist: Did you pay a security deposit?
Was deposit placed in escrow?
Was deposit returned within 30 days of move-out (if applicable)?
Was itemized list of deductions provided?
defenseOptions.remedy: May claim double damages for wrongfully withheld deposit

defenseOptions.name: Improper Notice
checklist: Was notice in writing?
Did notice specify the violation?
Was full 15-day period given?
Was notice properly served?

defenseOptions.name: Violation Cured
defenseOptions.description: Violation was corrected within notice period
checklist: What was the alleged violation?
Was it possible to cure?
Did you cure within 15 days?
Did landlord acknowledge cure?
documentation: Written notice to landlord of cure

defenseOptions.name: No Actual Violation
defenseOptions.description: Alleged conduct does not violate lease terms
checklist: What specific lease provision is cited?
Does your conduct actually violate that provision?
Is the lease provision clear and enforceable?

defenseOptions.name: Selective Enforcement
defenseOptions.description: Landlord enforces provision against you but ignores others' violations
checklist: Are other tenants violating same provision?
Has landlord taken action against them?
Is there pattern of discrimination?

defenseOptions.name: Landlord Breached First
defenseOptions.description: Landlord's prior breach may excuse tenant's conduct
checklist: How did landlord breach lease?
When did breach occur?
Is breach ongoing?
Did you give landlord notice of breach?

defenseOptions.name: Improper Termination Notice
checklist: Was proper notice given?
Was notice for full rental period?
Was notice properly served?

defenseOptions.name: New Tenancy Created
defenseOptions.description: Landlord's actions created new tenancy period
checklist: Did landlord accept rent after lease end?
Was there discussion of renewal?
Did landlord indicate tenancy would continue?

defenseOptions.name: Estoppel/Reliance
defenseOptions.description: Landlord's conduct led tenant to reasonably believe tenancy would continue
checklist: What did landlord say or do?
Did tenant rely on landlord's conduct?
Would eviction now be unfair?

critical.action: Note court date; prepare response; gather evidence
File appeal if grounds exist; post bond to stay eviction
Must vacate or face forcible removal

magisterialDistrict.name: Magisterial District Court
procedures: Complaint served on tenant by court
Judge rules same day in most cases
No jury trial in Magisterial District Court

filingAnswer.description: Tenant may file written answer before hearing

commonPleas.name: Court of Common Pleas
commonPleas.description: Hears appeals from Magisterial District Court
procedures: Appeal must be filed within 30 days
Supersedeas bond required to stay eviction

philadelphia.name: Philadelphia-Specific Rules
notes: Right to counsel program for low-income tenants
Special court procedures for residential cases

pittsburgh.name: Pittsburgh/Allegheny County Rules
notes: Some areas have tenant assistance programs
Check with local legal aid for current resources
